conclusion: To determine the number of moments when the speed is 5 m/s based on the given displacement-time graph.
The graph shows the displacement x as a function of time t. The displacement decreases from 10 m to -10 m over a period of 4 s.
Velocity v is the derivative of displacement with respect to time, v = dx/dt. On the graph, this corresponds to the slope of the tangent to the curve at any given point.
Speed is the magnitude of velocity, so we need to find the points where the magnitude of the slope of the tangent is 5 m/s.
At t = 0, the slope is negative and steep. As time increases, the slope decreases in magnitude (becomes less steep). At t = 4 s, the slope is positive and steep.
We need to find where the slope of the tangent is ±5 m/s.
The graph is smooth and continuous, suggesting a single continuous change in slope. Given the symmetry and the nature of the curve, there are likely two points where the slope is ±5 m/s.
Based on the analysis, there are two moments within the 0 to 4 seconds interval where the speed is 5 m/s.
There are two moments when the speed is 5 m/s.
